description: Coined as German Stöchiometrie by Jeremias Benjamin Richter in 1792.  From Ancient Greek στοιχεῖον (stoikheîon, “element”) +‎ -metry.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, chemistry) The study and calculation of quantitative (measurable) relationships of the reactants and products in chemical reactions (chemical equations).
(countable, chemistry) The quantitative relationship between the reactants and products of a specific reaction or equation.
